meanings.definition: To send or convey from one person or place to another.
meanings.sent1: I will transmit the message to your friend.
meanings.sent2: Please transmit the document to the office.
meanings.sent3: He tried to transmit his thoughts through a series of gestures.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to transmit happiness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The radio waves transmit information across long distances.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will transmit the knowledge to the students.
meanings.sent2: It is important to transmit the virus prevention tips to others.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to transmit its playful mood to the dog.
meanings.sent4: The legacy of kindness was transmitted through generations.
meanings.sent5: The relay race requires each runner to transmit the baton smoothly.

meanings.definition: To broadcast or communicate signals, information, or messages.
meanings.sent1: The radio station will transmit the news bulletin at noon.
meanings.sent2: The satellite can transmit data back to Earth.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to transmit a secret message to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse transmits a guiding light to ships at sea.
meanings.sent5: The internet can transmit vast amounts of information instantly.
